articles.description: Nottingham Forest could become the first side in Premier League history to finish in the top four with less than 40% average possession.
articles.title: Tottenham 1-2 Nottingham Forest: How Nuno Espirito Santo's side are bucking possession trend

articles.description: Burnley clinch promotion to the Premier League along with Leeds United as they defeat Sheffield United to consign to Blades to the play-offs
articles.title: Burnley 2-1 Sheffield United: Clarets promoted along with Leeds

articles.description: England's Gus Atkinson, Jamie Smith and Sophie Ecclestone are among Wisden's five cricketers of the year, with India's Jasprit Bumrah and Smriti Mandhana the world choices.
articles.title: Wisden Cricketers of the Year: Gus Atkinson, Jamie Smith and Sophie Ecclestone included

articles.description: Leeds United are promoted back to the Premier League after two years in the Championship.
articles.title: Leeds United promoted back to Premier League

articles.description: Emma Raducanu pauses the search for a new full-time coach, saying she is happy to "keep things informal" in her partnership with Mark Petchey.
articles.title: Emma Raducanu 'keeping things informal' with coach Mark Petchey as she returns to the Madrid Open

articles.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?
articles.title: Troy Deeney's Team of the Week: Elliot Anderson, Mateo Kovacic and Ollie Watkins feature

articles.description: Monday's four scheduled matches in the top flight of Italian football are postponed following the death of Pope Francis.
articles.title: Pope Francis: Italian Serie A matches postponed after pontiff's death

articles.description: Michael van Gerwen hits a nine-darter on his way to winning the German Darts Grand Prix in Munich.
articles.title: Michael van Gerwen wins German Grand Prix after hitting nine-darter

articles.description: Jelena Ostapenko beats world number one Aryna Sabalenka to win the Stuttgart Open in stunning fashion.
articles.title: Stuttgart Open: Jelena Ostapenko stuns world number one Aryna Sabalenka to win title

articles.description: Captain Virgil van Dijk says defender Trent Alexander-Arnold will "always be remembered" at Liverpool even if he decides to leave this summer.
articles.title: Liverpool: Virgil van Dijk on Trent Alexander-Arnold's future
